page.title: 03SKEGNESS LIFEBOAT
page.content: The{Skegness Lifeboat}is not an ordinary Lifeboat because it has to be launched by tractor.Because{Skegness} beach is flat the tide goes out along way and therefore the{Lifeboat}can't be launched down a slipway,it has to be towed into the water by a special sort of waterproof tractor.The name of the boat is{Charles Fredrick Grantham. There are eighteen crew men altogether which includes seven crew and eight Land and Launch men,two tractor drivers and one permanent man.{Ken {Holland}is the{Coxswain}of Skegness Lifeboat.The most common accident is inflateable airbeds and dinghies drifting out to sea.Airbeds if found are saved by the{Inshore Lifeboat.The {goverment does not help to pay any of {the money spent on the Lifeboat}and equipment.The crew are not paid for their work.They are all volunteers.
